SEARCH
Module passwordmanager
Package passwordmanager.backend.local.database

Class PreparedStatementGenerator

java.lang.Object
passwordmanager.backend.local.database.PreparedStatementGenerator
public class PreparedStatementGenerator extends Object
The PreparedStatementGenerator class is responsible for creating and preparing SQL PreparedStatements for various database operations related to managing entries and common email addresses within a password manager application. This class ensures SQL statements are safely prepared to avoid SQL injection vulnerabilities and manages SQL commands for inserting, updating, deleting, and querying data.

Instances of this class require an active Connection to the database, which must be provided at the time of construction. This connection is used to prepare all SQL statements. It is assumed that management of the database connection (such as opening and closing) is handled externally, allowing this class to focus solely on preparing statements based on provided parameters.

Each method in this class prepares a specific type of SQL statement, such as inserting new entries, updating existing entries, deleting entries, or querying the database for specific data. Prepared statements are returned to the caller, ready for execution, which allows for flexibility in transaction management and further processing.

Usage of this class helps centralize SQL statement preparation, contributing to cleaner code and separating database access concerns from business logic.

Usage example: 

 
 PreparedStatementGenerator generator = new PreparedStatementGenerator();
 PreparedStatement stmt = generator.prepareInsertEntryStatement(entry);
 stmt.execute();

  • Field Details

    • connection

      private final Connection connection

  • Constructor Details

    • PreparedStatementGenerator

      public PreparedStatementGenerator()
      Constructs an instance of PreparedStatementGenerator. Retrieves the database connection from DatabaseConnection.

  • Method Details

    • prepareEntryTableCreationStatement

      public PreparedStatement prepareEntryTableCreationStatement() throws SQLException
      Prepares a PreparedStatement for creating the entries table if it does not already exist. This method constructs an SQL statement to create a table with various fields necessary for storing entry data, including title, email, password, username, link, category, date created, and date modified. The title field is set as the primary key.
      Returns:
      a PreparedStatement that, when executed, will ensure the entries table exists with the correct schema.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error during the database access or query preparation.

    • prepareInsertEntryStatement

      public PreparedStatement prepareInsertEntryStatement(Entry entry) throws SQLException
      Prepares a PreparedStatement for inserting a new entry into the entries table. This method constructs the SQL query necessary to perform the insertion, setting up placeholders for the values to prevent SQL injection. The statement includes setting the current time for both DATE_CREATED and DATE_MODIFIED fields.
      Parameters:
      entry - the entry object containing the data to be inserted into the database.
      Returns:
      a PreparedStatement object ready for execution to insert the entry data.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error during the database access or query preparation.

    • prepareEntryUpdateStatement

      public PreparedStatement prepareEntryUpdateStatement(String title, String email, String secondaryEmail, String password, String username, String phoneNumber, String link, String category) throws SQLException
      Prepares a PreparedStatement for updating an existing entry in the entries table based on the title. This method allows selective updates where only specified fields (non-null parameters) are updated. The DATE_MODIFIED field is automatically set to the current timestamp to reflect the update time.

      Parameters that do not require updating should be passed as null.

      Parameters:
      title - the title of the entry to identify the record to update; must not be null.
      email - the new email to update, or null if no update is needed.
      secondaryEmail - the new secondary email to update, or null if no update is needed.
      password - the new password to update, or null if no update is needed.
      username - the new username to update, or null if no update is needed.
      phoneNumber - the new phone number to update, or null if no update is needed.
      link - the new link to update, or null if no update is needed.
      category - the new category to update, or null if no update is needed.
      Returns:
      a PreparedStatement object that contains the SQL query with placeholders. This prepared statement can then be executed after setting the appropriate parameter values.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error during the database access or query preparation.

    • prepareRemoveEntryStatement

      public PreparedStatement prepareRemoveEntryStatement(String title) throws SQLException
      Prepares a PreparedStatement for deleting an entry from the entries table based on the title. This method constructs an SQL command to remove a specific record where the title matches the given parameter.
      Parameters:
      title - the title of the entry that identifies the record to be deleted.
      Returns:
      a PreparedStatement object that can be executed to delete the specified entry from the database. The statement includes a single placeholder for the title of the entry to be deleted.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error during the database access or the query preparation process.

    • prepareGetEntryStatement

      public PreparedStatement prepareGetEntryStatement(String title) throws SQLException
      Prepares a PreparedStatement to retrieve a specific entry from the entries table based on the title. This method constructs an SQL query to select all columns from the entries table where the title matches the specified parameter.
      Parameters:
      title - the title of the entry to retrieve.
      Returns:
      a PreparedStatement that can be executed to fetch the entry data from the database. The statement includes a placeholder for the title of the entry.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error during database access or query preparation.

    • prepareGetAllEntryTitlesStatement

      public PreparedStatement prepareGetAllEntryTitlesStatement() throws SQLException
      Prepares a PreparedStatement to retrieve the titles of all entries from the entries table. This method constructs an SQL query to select only the title column from the entries table.
      Returns:
      a PreparedStatement that can be executed to fetch all entry titles from the database.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error during database access or query preparation.

    • prepareGetListOfGroupsStatement

      public PreparedStatement prepareGetListOfGroupsStatement() throws SQLException
      Prepares a PreparedStatement to retrieve a list of groups from the database. This method constructs an SQL query that selects all distinct categories from the entries table.
      Returns:
      A PreparedStatement object that, when executed, will return a ResultSet containing all distinct categories from the entries table.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error during database access or query preparation.
